content.description: A student determines the concentration of an <math alttext="N a B r, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>NaBr</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> solution by adding <math alttext="A g N O 3, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>AgNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> until no more <math alttext="A g B r, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>AgBr</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> precipitate is formed. The precipitate is filtered out of the solution and then dried and weighed. The student uses the mass of the precipitate to determine the concentration of the <math alttext="N a B r, aqueous" overflow="scroll"> <mi>NaBr</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> solution.
content.question: Which of the following could result in the student calculating a concentration of <math alttext="N a B r, aqueous" overflow="scroll"> <mi>NaBr</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> that is higher than the actual concentration?

choices.label: The <math alttext="A g B r, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>AgBr</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> was not completely dried before being weighed.

Some of the <math alttext="A g B r, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>AgBr</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> fell off the filter paper onto the balance while being weighed.

An insufficient amount of <math alttext="A g N O 3, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>AgNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> was added, so some <math alttext="N a B r, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>NaBr</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> was left in solution.

The filter paper had a hole in it, and some of the <math alttext="A g B r, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>AgBr</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> precipitate washed through the filter paper.

content.answer: The <math alttext="A g B r, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>AgBr</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> was not completely dried before being weighed.

skill.text: 2.E: Identify or describe potential sources of experimental error.
